section.title: When partitioning is useful
section.para: Knowledge base partitioning is a very powerful feature for specific scenarios, but it is not a general case solution. To understand if this feature would be useful for a given scenario, the user may follow the checklist bellow:

listitem.para: Does your hardware contains multiple processors?
Does your knowledge session process a high volume of facts?
Are the LHS of your rules expensive to evaluate? (ex: use expensive "from" expressions)
Does your knowledge base contains hundreds or more rules?

section.para: If the answer to all the questions above is "yes", then this feature will probably increase the overall performance of your rulebase evaluation.
